Compliance Audits: There are procedures to conduct regular audits of the RMP program to ensure that the program is in place and working properly.

The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:
There have been no incidents identified for the Stonehaven Van facility within the last five years that have resulted in any onsite or offsite impacts.

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:
An emergency action program has been implemented at the Van facility. This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures. The program has been coordinated with the Seneca Volunteer Fire Department.
The emergency action program consists of the following elements:
•	Organization Plan and Responsibilities
•	Communications Procedures
•	Detailed Action Plans
•	Emergency Medical Treatment Procedures
•	Evacuation Plans
•	Description of Outside Assistance Available
•	Site Re-Entry Procedures
•	Training Programs and Drills

Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:
Stonehaven is committed to continuous improvement and looks for opportunities to improve safety systems and programs at the facility.

ees in establishing and implementing the program. Employees are also to be involved when a process hazard analysis is conducted. The program also ensures that all employees have complete access to the program.
Process Safety Information: Written information has been collected which enables the employees to identify and understand the potential hazards in the system. The written information includes SDSs and a description of the design of the Van Compressor Station.
Process Hazard Analysis: Formal studies using the HAZOP technique have been conducted to look at the system and identify potential hazards.
Operating Procedures:  Written, detailed procedures have been developed which describe the steps which should be followed to safely operate the Van Compressor Station.
Training: A training program has been developed which ensures that employees are trained on all aspects of the system and on the duties which they should perform to ensure the safe operation of the Van Compressor Station.
Contractors: All contractors are screened and evaluated before they perform work on or near the Van Compressor Station. The contractors are also periodically evaluated to ensure that they perform work by following safe work practices.
Pre-Startup Safety Review: A pre-startup safety review is completed for all new projects to verify that all safety programs are in place, training has been performed, and construction has been completed according to design standards before the project is put into use.
Mechanical Integrity: This program ensures that the Van Compressor Station are built and maintained using preventive maintenance procedures to minimize unexpected breakdowns or failures.
Hot Work Permit: These procedures ensure that a signed permit is obtained prior to any cutting, welding, or burning.
Management of Change: The procedures are designed to ensure that all changes made to the Van Compressor Station are properly reviewed.

Stonehaven Energy Management Company operates a natural gas compressor and liquid extraction station in Van, Pennsylvania. This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures, and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements - Risk Management Program pursuant to Title 40 Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR 68).

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:
Stonehaven's accidental release prevention policy involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) involves the preparation of response plans that are tailored to this facility and to the emergency response services available in the community. 

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:
Stationary Source, Regulated Substances Handles & Covered Process:
The Stonehaven Van, Pennsylvania facility has a natural gas liquid (NGL) extraction process along with an NGL storage tank and a tanker truck loading area. The site has one regulated substance, a flammable mixture of Natural Gas Liquids (NGL), stored in an aboveground storage tank above the RMP threshold amount. The NGL consists of a mixture of hydrocarbons including propane, butane, isobutane, and pentane. NGL is periodically loaded in tanker trucks and sent offsite.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response programs help prevent accidents because they focus on the rules, procedures, and practices which govern individual processes, activities, or pieces of equipment. These rules are detailed and improved, as necessary.  They are also communicated to and accepted by all employees at the facility. The prevention program consists of the following elements:
